text.p: Click on a column header to sort the table.

ROW.title: Creator's Contact Info
ROW.tagdesc: The creator's contact information provides all necessary information to get in contact with the creator of this news object and comprises a set of sub-properties for proper addressing.

ROW.title: Contact Info-Address
ROW.tagdesc: sub-key Creator Contact Info: address. Comprises an optional company name and all required information to locate the building or postbox to which mail should be sent.

ROW.title: Contact Info-State/Province
ROW.tagdesc: sub-key Creator Contact Info: state or province.

ROW.title: Contact Info-Postal Code
ROW.tagdesc: sub-key Creator Contact Info: local postal code.

ROW.title: Contact Info-Email
ROW.tagdesc: sub-key Creator Contact Info: email address.

ROW.title: Contact Info-Phone
ROW.tagdesc: sub-key Creator Contact Info: phone number.

ROW.title: Contact Info-Web URL
ROW.tagdesc: sub-key Creator Contact Info: web address.

ROW.title: Intellectual Genre
ROW.tagdesc: Describes the nature, intellectual or journalistic characteristic of a news object, not specifically its content.

ROW.title: IPTC Scene
ROW.tagdesc: Describes the scene of a photo content. Specifies one or more terms from the IPTC "Scene-NewsCodes". Each Scene is represented as a string of 6 digits in an unordered list.

ROW.title: IPTC Subject Code
ROW.tagdesc: Specifies one or more Subjects from the IPTC "Subject-NewsCodes" taxonomy to categorize the content. Each Subject is represented as a string of 8 digits in an unordered list.

ROW.title: Location
ROW.tagdesc: (legacy) Name of a location the content is focussing on -- either the location shown in visual media or referenced by text or audio media. This location name could either be the name of a sublocation to a city or the name of a well known location or (natural) monument outside a city. In the sense of a sublocation to a city this element is at the fourth level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.

ROW.title: Country Code
ROW.tagdesc: (legacy) Code of the country the content is focussing on -- either the country shown in visual media or referenced in text or audio media. This element is at the top/first level of a top-down geographical hierarchy. The code should be taken from ISO 3166 two or three letter code. The full name of a country should go to the "Country" element.
